property.name: text
property.value:
This is just an experimental system, so the UI is very primitive and basic. To experiment with it, do the following (for the case when no prior selection is made):
1. double click on the accessor, make a selection, press commit 2. double click on the accessor, press the reload button and then press commit 3. double click on the accessor again and the required input for the selected REST service will appear on the editor menu: a. for GSN, enter 'pluto.cs.txstate.edu' for the host, enter '22001' for the port, leave the rest as default b. for Paraimpu, enter 'api.paraimpu.com' for the host, enter'443' for the port, enter this is '46e0ee55195c4dd9dca295a7ac8282d28f4a2259' for access token c. for Firebase, enter 'https://sizzling-fire-8605.firebaseio.com' for the host, enter '443' for port and leave the rest as default. You can change the type of data you want to retrieve by changing the value in path. For example changing it to 'sensors.json' will retrieve data about various sensor last recorded values.

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value: This accessor discovers IOT services on web. It requires the contextAware module. Please see: https://www.icyphy.org/accessors/wiki/Version0/ContextAware

property.name: {{string} (parameter)
property.value: the name of the REST service that context aware tries to adapt. A list of available services are presented as option.
